summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, setting a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, and establishing a schedule for jury selection procedures including a juror questionnaire, voir dire, and related pretrial conferences.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, setting the trial date and procedural schedule.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, issuing procedural orders for the trial.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The jury trial in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for an in-person pretrial conference.

events.title: Previous Schedule Order
events.description: The Court had previously set a schedule on this date, which is amended by this order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court has set a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Jury selection procedures include administering a juror questionnaire on November 4, 5, and 12, 2021, and conducting voir dire from November 16-19, 2021.
The order establishes deadlines for the parties to submit joint proposals for the juror questionnaire, voir dire, jury charges, and motions in limine in October 2021.
The order references COVID-19 protocols affecting courtroom space and jury trial scheduling in the district.
